1.text: Search for small holes in your yard without soil around them.

2.text: Pack dirt into any small holes in your lawn for a temporary fix.

3.text: Use gravel so the chipmunk can’t dig a hole in the same place.

4.text: Try pouring concrete near holes in areas where you aren’t planting anything.

6.text: Set up chipmunk traps around your yard so you can relocate them.

7.text: Spray coyote or fox urine around your yard and burrows to scare chipmunks away.

8.text: Keep bird feeders 20–30 ft (6.1–9.1 m) from your home to move a food source.

9.text: Let any pets outside to scare away chipmunks.

10.text: Look for holes are cracks that are 2 in (5.1 cm) wide or larger.

11.text: Use caulk or concrete to fill in the outdoor holes that you find.

12.text: Cover vents, chimneys, and pipes with mesh so chipmunks can’t fit inside.
